5#ifndef V8_AST_VARIABLES_H_
6#define V8_AST_VARIABLES_H_
7
8#include "src/ast/ast-value-factory.h"
9#include "src/base/threaded-list.h"
10#include "src/common/globals.h"
11#include "src/zone/zone-containers.h"
12#include "src/zone/zone.h"
13
14namespace v8 {
15namespace internal {
16
17// The AST refers to variables via VariableProxies - placeholders for the actual
18// variables. Variables themselves are never directly referred to from the AST,
19// they are maintained by scopes, and referred to from VariableProxies and Slots
20// after binding and variable allocation.
21class Variable final : public ZoneObject {
22 public:
23 Variable(Scope* scope, const AstRawString* name, VariableMode mode,
24 VariableKind kind, InitializationFlag initialization_flag,
25 MaybeAssignedFlag maybe_assigned_flag = kNotAssigned,
26 IsStaticFlag is_static_flag = IsStaticFlag::kNotStatic)
27 : scope_(scope),
28 name_(name),
29 local_if_not_shadowed_(nullptr),
30 next_(nullptr),
31 index_(-1),
32 initializer_position_(kNoSourcePosition),
33 bit_field_(MaybeAssignedFlagField::encode(maybe_assigned_flag) |
34 InitializationFlagField::encode(initialization_flag) |
35 VariableModeField::encode(mode) |
36 IsUsedField::encode(false) |
37 ForceContextAllocationBit::encode(false) |
38 LocationField::encode(VariableLocation::UNALLOCATED) |
39 VariableKindField::encode(kind) |
40 IsStaticFlagField::encode(is_static_flag)),
41 hole_check_analysis_bit_field_(HoleCheckBitmapIndexField::encode(
42 kUncacheableHoleCheckBitmapIndex) |
43 ForceHoleInitializationFlagField::encode(
44 kHoleInitializationNotForced)) {
45 // Var declared variables never need initialization.
46 DCHECK(!(mode == VariableMode::kVar &&
47 initialization_flag == kNeedsInitialization));
48 DCHECK_IMPLIES(is_static_flag == IsStaticFlag::kStatic,
49 IsImmutableLexicalOrPrivateVariableMode(mode));
50 }
51
52 explicit Variable(Variable* other);
53
54 // The source code for an eval() call may refer to a variable that is
55 // in an outer scope about which we don't know anything (it may not
56 // be the script scope). scope() is nullptr in that case. Currently the
57 // scope is only used to follow the context chain length.
58 Scope* scope() const { return scope_; }
59
60 // This is for adjusting the scope of temporaries used when desugaring
61 // parameter initializers.
62 void set_scope(Scope* scope) { scope_ = scope; }
63
64 Handle<String> name() const { return name_->string(); }
65 const AstRawString* raw_name() const { return name_; }
66 VariableMode mode() const { return VariableModeField::decode(bit_field_); }
67 void set_mode(VariableMode mode) {
68 bit_field_ = VariableModeField::update(bit_field_, mode);
69 }
70 void set_is_static_flag(IsStaticFlag is_static_flag) {
71 bit_field_ = IsStaticFlagField::update(bit_field_, is_static_flag);
72 }
73 IsStaticFlag is_static_flag() const {
74 return IsStaticFlagField::decode(bit_field_);
75 }
76 bool is_static() const { return is_static_flag() == IsStaticFlag::kStatic; }
77
78 bool has_forced_context_allocation() const {
79 return ForceContextAllocationBit::decode(bit_field_);
80 }
81 void ForceContextAllocation() {
82 DCHECK(IsUnallocated() || IsContextSlot() || IsLookupSlot() ||
83 location() == VariableLocation::MODULE);
84 bit_field_ = ForceContextAllocationBit::update(bit_field_, true);
85 }
86 bool is_used() { return IsUsedField::decode(bit_field_); }
87 void set_is_used() { bit_field_ = IsUsedField::update(bit_field_, true); }
88 MaybeAssignedFlag maybe_assigned() const {
89 return MaybeAssignedFlagField::decode(bit_field_);
90 }
91 void clear_maybe_assigned() {
92 bit_field_ = MaybeAssignedFlagField::update(bit_field_, kNotAssigned);
93 }
94 void SetMaybeAssigned() {
95 if (IsImmutableLexicalVariableMode(mode())) {
96 return;
97 }
98 // Private names are only initialized once by us.
99 if (name_->IsPrivateName()) {
100 return;
101 }
102 // If this variable is dynamically shadowing another variable, then that
103 // variable could also be assigned (in the non-shadowing case).
104 if (has_local_if_not_shadowed()) {
105 // Avoid repeatedly marking the same tree of variables by only recursing
106 // when this variable's maybe_assigned status actually changes.
107 if (!maybe_assigned()) {
108 local_if_not_shadowed()->SetMaybeAssigned();
109 }
110 DCHECK_IMPLIES(
111 (!IsImmutableLexicalVariableMode(local_if_not_shadowed()->mode())),
112 local_if_not_shadowed()->maybe_assigned());
113 }
114 set_maybe_assigned();
115 }
116
117 bool requires_brand_check() const {
118 return IsPrivateMethodOrAccessorVariableMode(mode());
119 }
120
121 int initializer_position() { return initializer_position_; }
122 void set_initializer_position(int pos) { initializer_position_ = pos; }
123
124 bool IsUnallocated() const {
125 return location() == VariableLocation::UNALLOCATED;
126 }
127 bool IsParameter() const { return location() == VariableLocation::PARAMETER; }
128 bool IsStackLocal() const { return location() == VariableLocation::LOCAL; }
129 bool IsStackAllocated() const { return IsParameter() || IsStackLocal(); }
130 bool IsContextSlot() const { return location() == VariableLocation::CONTEXT; }
131 bool IsLookupSlot() const { return location() == VariableLocation::LOOKUP; }
132 bool IsGlobalObjectProperty() const;
133
134 // True for 'let' and 'const' variables declared in the script scope of a REPL
135 // script.
136 bool IsReplGlobal() const;
137
138 bool is_dynamic() const { return IsDynamicVariableMode(mode()); }
139
140 // Returns the InitializationFlag this Variable was created with.
141 // Scope analysis may allow us to relax this initialization
142 // requirement, which will be reflected in the return value of
143 // binding_needs_init().
144 InitializationFlag initialization_flag() const {
145 return InitializationFlagField::decode(bit_field_);
146 }
147
148 // Whether this variable needs to be initialized with the hole at
149 // declaration time. Only returns valid results after scope analysis.
150 bool binding_needs_init() const {
151 DCHECK_IMPLIES(initialization_flag() == kNeedsInitialization,
152 IsLexicalVariableMode(mode()) ||
153 IsPrivateMethodOrAccessorVariableMode(mode()));
154 DCHECK_IMPLIES(IsHoleInitializationForced(),
155 initialization_flag() == kNeedsInitialization);
156
157 // Always initialize if hole initialization was forced during
158 // scope analysis.
159 if (IsHoleInitializationForced()) return true;
160
161 // If initialization was not forced, no need for initialization
162 // for stack allocated variables, since UpdateNeedsHoleCheck()
163 // in scopes.cc has proven that no VariableProxy refers to
164 // this variable in such a way that a runtime hole check
165 // would be generated.
166 if (IsStackAllocated()) return false;
167
168 // Otherwise, defer to the flag set when this Variable was constructed.
169 return initialization_flag() == kNeedsInitialization;
170 }
171
172 enum ForceHoleInitializationFlag {
173 kHoleInitializationNotForced = 0,
174 kHasHoleCheckUseInDifferentClosureScope = 1 << 0,
175 kHasHoleCheckUseInSameClosureScope = 1 << 1,
176 kHasHoleCheckUseInUnknownScope = kHasHoleCheckUseInDifferentClosureScope |
177 kHasHoleCheckUseInSameClosureScope
178 };
179 ForceHoleInitializationFlag force_hole_initialization_flag_field() const {
180 return ForceHoleInitializationFlagField::decode(
181 hole_check_analysis_bit_field_);
182 }
183
184 bool IsHoleInitializationForced() const {
185 return force_hole_initialization_flag_field() !=
186 kHoleInitializationNotForced;
187 }
188
189 bool HasHoleCheckUseInSameClosureScope() const {
190 return force_hole_initialization_flag_field() &
191 kHasHoleCheckUseInSameClosureScope;
192 }
193
194 // Called during scope analysis when a VariableProxy is found to
195 // reference this Variable in such a way that a hole check will
196 // be required at runtime.
197 void ForceHoleInitialization(ForceHoleInitializationFlag flag) {
198 DCHECK_EQ(kNeedsInitialization, initialization_flag());
199 DCHECK_NE(kHoleInitializationNotForced, flag);
200 DCHECK(IsLexicalVariableMode(mode()) ||
201 IsPrivateMethodOrAccessorVariableMode(mode()));
202 hole_check_analysis_bit_field_ |=
203 ForceHoleInitializationFlagField::encode(flag);
204 }
205
206 // The first N-1 lexical bindings that need hole checks in a compilation are
207 // numbered, where N is the number of bits in HoleCheckBitmap. This number is
208 // an index into a bitmap that the BytecodeGenerator uses to elide redundant
209 // hole checks.
210 using HoleCheckBitmap = uint64_t;
211
212 // The 0th index is reserved for bindings for which the BytecodeGenerator
213 // should not elide hole checks, such as for bindings beyond the first N-1.
214 //
215 // This index in the bitmap must always be 0.
216 static constexpr uint8_t kUncacheableHoleCheckBitmapIndex = 0;
217 static constexpr uint8_t kHoleCheckBitmapBits =
218 std::numeric_limits<HoleCheckBitmap>::digits;
219
220 void ResetHoleCheckBitmapIndex() {
221 hole_check_analysis_bit_field_ = HoleCheckBitmapIndexField::update(
222 hole_check_analysis_bit_field_, kUncacheableHoleCheckBitmapIndex);
223 }
224
225 void RememberHoleCheckInBitmap(HoleCheckBitmap& bitmap,
226 ZoneVector<Variable*>& list) {
227 DCHECK(v8_flags.ignition_elide_redundant_tdz_checks);
228 uint8_t index = HoleCheckBitmapIndex();
229 if (V8_UNLIKELY(index == kUncacheableHoleCheckBitmapIndex)) {
230 index = list.size() + 1;
231 // The bitmap is full.
232 if (index == kHoleCheckBitmapBits) return;
233 AssignHoleCheckBitmapIndex(list, index);
234 }
235 bitmap |= HoleCheckBitmap{1} << index;
236 DCHECK_EQ(
237 0, bitmap & (HoleCheckBitmap{1} << kUncacheableHoleCheckBitmapIndex));
238 }
239
240 bool HasRememberedHoleCheck(HoleCheckBitmap bitmap) const {
241 uint8_t index = HoleCheckBitmapIndex();
242 bool result = bitmap & (HoleCheckBitmap{1} << index);
243 DCHECK_IMPLIES(index == kUncacheableHoleCheckBitmapIndex, !result);
244 return result;
245 }
246
247 bool throw_on_const_assignment(LanguageMode language_mode) const {
248 return kind() != SLOPPY_FUNCTION_NAME_VARIABLE || is_strict(language_mode);
249 }
250
251 bool is_this() const { return kind() == THIS_VARIABLE; }
252 bool is_sloppy_function_name() const {
253 return kind() == SLOPPY_FUNCTION_NAME_VARIABLE;
254 }
255
256 bool is_parameter() const { return kind() == PARAMETER_VARIABLE; }
257 bool is_sloppy_block_function() {
258 return kind() == SLOPPY_BLOCK_FUNCTION_VARIABLE;
259 }
260
261 Variable* local_if_not_shadowed() const {
262 DCHECK((mode() == VariableMode::kDynamicLocal ||
263 mode() == VariableMode::kDynamic) &&
264 has_local_if_not_shadowed());
265 return local_if_not_shadowed_;
266 }
267
268 bool has_local_if_not_shadowed() const {
269 return local_if_not_shadowed_ != nullptr;
270 }
271
272 void set_local_if_not_shadowed(Variable* local) {
273 local_if_not_shadowed_ = local;
274 }
275
276 VariableLocation location() const {
277 return LocationField::decode(bit_field_);
278 }
279 VariableKind kind() const { return VariableKindField::decode(bit_field_); }
280
281 int index() const { return index_; }
282
283 bool IsReceiver() const {
284 DCHECK(IsParameter());
285
286 return index_ == -1;
287 }
288
289 bool IsExport() const {
290 DCHECK_EQ(location(), VariableLocation::MODULE);
291 DCHECK_NE(index(), 0);
292 return index() > 0;
293 }
294
295 void AllocateTo(VariableLocation location, int index) {
296 DCHECK(IsUnallocated() ||
297 (this->location() == location && this->index() == index));
298 DCHECK_IMPLIES(location == VariableLocation::MODULE, index != 0);
299 bit_field_ = LocationField::update(bit_field_, location);
300 DCHECK_EQ(location, this->location());
301 index_ = index;
302 }
303
304 void MakeParameterNonSimple() {
305 DCHECK(is_parameter());
306 bit_field_ = VariableModeField::update(bit_field_, VariableMode::kLet);
307 bit_field_ =
308 InitializationFlagField::update(bit_field_, kNeedsInitialization);
309 }
310
311 static InitializationFlag DefaultInitializationFlag(VariableMode mode) {
312 DCHECK(IsDeclaredVariableMode(mode));
313 return mode == VariableMode::kVar ? kCreatedInitialized
314 : kNeedsInitialization;
315 }
316
317 // Rewrites the VariableLocation of repl script scope 'lets' to REPL_GLOBAL.
318 void RewriteLocationForRepl();
319
320 using List = base::ThreadedList<Variable>;
321
322 private:
323 Scope* scope_;
324 const AstRawString* name_;
325
326 // If this field is set, this variable references the stored locally bound
327 // variable, but it might be shadowed by variable bindings introduced by with
328 // blocks or sloppy 'eval' calls between the reference scope (inclusive) and
329 // the binding scope (exclusive).
330 Variable* local_if_not_shadowed_;
331 Variable* next_;
332 int index_;
333 int initializer_position_;
334 uint16_t bit_field_;
335 uint16_t hole_check_analysis_bit_field_;
336
337 void set_maybe_assigned() {
338 bit_field_ = MaybeAssignedFlagField::update(bit_field_, kMaybeAssigned);
339 }
340
341 uint8_t HoleCheckBitmapIndex() const {
342 return HoleCheckBitmapIndexField::decode(hole_check_analysis_bit_field_);
343 }
344
345 void AssignHoleCheckBitmapIndex(ZoneVector<Variable*>& list,
346 uint8_t next_index);
347
348 using VariableModeField = base::BitField16<VariableMode, 0, 4>;
349 using VariableKindField = VariableModeField::Next<VariableKind, 3>;
350 using LocationField = VariableKindField::Next<VariableLocation, 3>;
351 using ForceContextAllocationBit = LocationField::Next<bool, 1>;
352 using IsUsedField = ForceContextAllocationBit::Next<bool, 1>;
353 using InitializationFlagField = IsUsedField::Next<InitializationFlag, 1>;
354 using MaybeAssignedFlagField =
355 InitializationFlagField::Next<MaybeAssignedFlag, 1>;
356 using IsStaticFlagField = MaybeAssignedFlagField::Next<IsStaticFlag, 1>;
357
358 using HoleCheckBitmapIndexField = base::BitField16<uint8_t, 0, 8>;
359 using ForceHoleInitializationFlagField =
360 HoleCheckBitmapIndexField::Next<ForceHoleInitializationFlag, 2>;
361
362 Variable** next() { return &next_; }
363 friend List;
364 friend base::ThreadedListTraits<Variable>;
365};
366} // namespace internal
367} // namespace v8
368
369#endif // V8_AST_VARIABLES_H_
